Sentencas: The present study shows the development of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC) using conventional yttria stabilized zirconia (YSZ) materials and wet chemistry techniques for both the synthesis and deposition of components.
Titulo: Development and tests of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with electrolyte layer deposited by spin-coating

Sentencas: Electrodes have been synthesized at IPEN by using wet chemistry techniques, which result in controlled phase composition and homogeneous particle size distribution.
Titulo: Development and tests of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with electrolyte layer deposited by spin-coating

Sentencas: Ceramic suspensions of YSZ were developed for their deposition by spin coating to attain similar to 10 mu m thick layers with a reduced number of coating steps.
Titulo: Development and tests of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with electrolyte layer deposited by spin-coating

Sentencas: Half-cells (anode support/electrolyte) are co-sintered in the 1300 - 1500 degrees C temperature range.
Titulo: Development and tests of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with electrolyte layer deposited by spin-coating

Sentencas: Strontium-doped lanthanum manganite cathodes were deposited by wet powder spray of ethanol-based suspensions, followed by a heat treatment at 1200 degrees C.
Titulo: Development and tests of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with electrolyte layer deposited by spin-coating

Sentencas: The electrochemical properties of single SOFCs were measured in the 600-800 degrees C temperature range, using humidified hydrogen (3 vol.
Titulo: Development and tests of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with electrolyte layer deposited by spin-coating

Sentencas: % H2O) as fuel and air as the oxidant.
Titulo: Development and tests of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with electrolyte layer deposited by spin-coating

Sentencas: The main results evidenced that electrolyte layers are dense and homogeneous, as inferred from scanning electron microscopy analysis.
Titulo: Development and tests of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with electrolyte layer deposited by spin-coating

Sentencas: Single SOFCs showed open circuit voltage of similar to 1V and good performance at intermediate temperatures, further confirming the gas tightness and good quality of spin coated electrolyte layers.
Titulo: Development and tests of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells with electrolyte layer deposited by spin-coating
